    • Constructor Detail

      • Place

        public Place(java.lang.String name,
             double area,
             java.util.Calendar inaugurationDate,
             java.lang.String photo,
             double resources,
             int intType,
             int intDepartment,
             Community caregivingCommunity)

        Place

        Description: Initializes and creates an instance of Place with the specified parameters. The constructor sets the attributes of the Place object using the provided parameters.

        Preconditions:

        • name must be a non-null String.
        • area must be a double.
        • inaugurationDate must be a non-null Calendar object.
        • photo must be a String.
        • resources must be a double.
        • intType must be an int between 1 and 3.
        • intDepartment must be an int between 1 and 4.
        • caregivingCommunity must be a non-null and preexisting Community instance.

        Postconditions:

        • An instance of Place is created with all the specified parameters set.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the place.
        area - The area of the place in km2.
        inaugurationDate - The inauguration date of the place.
        photo - The URL that holds a photo of the place.
        resources - The resources allocated to maintain the place.
        intType - The type of the place.
        intDepartment - The department of the place is located in.
        caregivingCommunity - The caregiving community associated with the place.

    • Method Detail

      • addSpecies

        public java.lang.String addSpecies(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String photo,
                                   int localPop,
                                   int intSpeciesType)

        addSpecies

        Description: Associates a new species with the specified place and returns a success message. First, it checks if there is a duplicate species with the same name already existing within the place. If so, a duplicate message is returned. Second, it checks if there is space to register a new species within the place. If not, a no space message will be returned.

        Preconditions:

        • name must be a String.
        • photo must be a String.
        • intSpeciesType must be an int between 1 and 2.
        • localPop must be an int.

        Postconditions:

        • If a species with the same name already exists within the place, a duplicate message is returned.
        • If there is no more space to register a new species within the place, a no space message is returned.
        • Otherwise, the new species is added to the species array of the place, and a success message is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the species.
        photo - The URL of a photo that contains the species.
        localPop - The local population of the species.
        intSpeciesType - The type of the species.
        Returns:
        A message stating if the species was added successfully or not (showing the reason if it wasn't successful).

      • modifySpecies

        public java.lang.String modifySpecies(int intSpecies,
                                      int intModification,
                                      java.lang.String newName,
                                      java.lang.String newPhoto,
                                      int newLocalPop,
                                      int newSpeciesType)

        modifySpecies

        Description: Helps in the process of modifying species data within the specified place and returns a message indicating success or failure. The method retrieves the species based on the provided index and passes it on to the appropriate species's method to perform the modification). Based on the modification int, it will go and set the newName, newPhoto, newLocalPopulation or newSpeciesType. In case of changing the name, the method will check if the newName that is being entered already exists.

        Preconditions:

        • intSpecies must be an integer representing an existing species.
        • intModification must be an integer representing the type of modification (e.g., name, photo, local population, species type).
        • newName must be a String.
        • newPhoto must be a String.
        • newLocalPop must be an int.
        • newSpeciesType must be an int between one and two.

        Postconditions:

        • If the species data is successfully modified, a success message is returned.
        • If the user wants to change the speciesName it will first be checked if that name is already used.
        Parameters:
        intSpecies - The index of the species to be modified.
        intModification - The type of modification to be performed (e.g., name, photo, local population, species type).
        newName - The new name for the species.
        newPhoto - The new photo URL for the species.
        newLocalPop - The new local population for the species.
        newSpeciesType - The new species type for the species.
        Returns:
        A message indicating if the species data was successfully modified or not.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

        toString

        Description: Generates a string representation of the place, including various attributes such as name, area, inauguration date, photo, resources, place type, department, caregiving community, and species information. This method follows these steps to construct the string representation:
        1. Formats the inauguration date into a string representation using the specified date format.
        2. Constructs a string representation of the place with placeholders for the attributes.
        3. Returns the formatted string containing all the information about the place, including: the descriptions for the department and type literals, and the species information obtained through the displaySpecies() method.

        Preconditions:

        • intPlace must be an integer representing an existing place.

        Postconditions:

        • A string containing the information about the specified place is returned.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string containing the information about the specified place.

      • speciesCount

        public int speciesCount()

        speciesCount

        Description: Calculates and returns the number of species associated with the place. This method counts the non-null elements in the array of species belonging to the place.

        Preconditions:

        • species array in the place object must be initialized.

        Postconditions:

        • The number of species associated with the place is returned.
        Returns:
        The number of species associated with the place.

      • intToDepartment

        public static Department intToDepartment(int intDepartment)

        intToDepartment

        Description: Converts the integer representation of a department to its corresponding Department literal. It delegates the conversion to the Department.intToDepartment(int) method.

        Preconditions:

        • intDepartment must be an int between 1 and 4.

        Postconditions:

        • The corresponding Department literal value is returned based on the provided integer.
        Parameters:
        intDepartment - The int representing the department.
        Returns:
        The Department enum value corresponding to the provided int.

      • getDepartments

        public static java.lang.String[] getDepartments()

        getDepartments

        Description: Retrieves the array of departments from the Department class and returns it.

        Preconditions:

        • getDepartments method in the Department class must be in place.

        Postconditions:

        • An array of department names is returned containing all available departments.
        Returns:
        A String[] holding all the descriptions representing the Department literals.

      • getPlaceTypes

        public static java.lang.String[] getPlaceTypes()

        getPlaceTypes

        Description: Retrieves the array of place types from the PlaceType class and returns it.

        Preconditions:

        • getPlaceTypes method in the PlaceType class must be in place.

        Postconditions:

        • An array of place type names is returned containing all available place types.
        Returns:
        A String[] holding all the descriptions representing the PlaceType literals.

      • getSpeciesTypes

        public static java.lang.String[] getSpeciesTypes()

        getSpeciesTypes

        Description: Retrieves an array containing descriptions of all species types available. The actual organization of the String[] is done by Species.getSpeciesTypes().

        Preconditions:

        • getSpeciesTypes method in the Species class must be in place.

        Postconditions:

        • An array of species type names is returned containing all available species types.
        Returns:
        A String[] holding all the descriptions representing the species type literals.

      • searchSpecies

        public boolean searchSpecies(java.lang.String speciesName)

        searchSpecies

        Description: Verifies if the entered species name already exists in the array of species. It iterates through all the existing species and checks if the name matches the entered species name.

        Preconditions:

        • species array holding the species must already be initialized.
        • speciesName must be a String.

        Postconditions:

        • A boolean indicating if a duplicate species name was found or not.
        Parameters:
        speciesName - The name of the species to be searched for in the species array.
        Returns:
        A boolean indicating if there is a duplicate species name or not.

      • availableSpecies

        public int availableSpecies()

        availableSpecies

        Description: Checks for the availability of space in the array of species to accommodate another species. It iterates through the species array and verifies if each element is null. If an element is null, it returns the index of that element. If no null elements are found, it returns -1 indicating no available space.

        Preconditions:

        • The array holding the species must already be initialized.

        Postconditions:

        • Returns the index of the last null element in the species array if space is available. If there is no more space, returns -1.
        Returns:
        An integer representing the index of the last null element in the species array (returns -1 if there is no available space).

      • oneMinSpecies

        public boolean oneMinSpecies()

        oneMinProduct

        Description: Checks if at least one product was registered already.

        Preconditions:

        • Array of products must already exist.

        Postconditions:

        • A boolean value indicating if the first position in the products array is occupied or not is returned.
        Returns:
        true if the first position of the products array is filled, false otherwise.

      • displaySpecies

        public java.lang.String displaySpecies()

        displayProducts

        Description: Concatenates and returns a string that holds all the descriptions of the products within the community. It iterates through the products array, assigns a number to each product, and extracts the product names. It makes sure that no null product is passed on to prevent a Null Exception.

        Preconditions:

        • products must be in place and initialized.

        Postconditions:

        • A String holding all the numbered product names in order will be returned.
        Returns:
        A String containing all the numbered product names within the community.

      • intToSpecies

        public Species intToSpecies(int intSpecies)

        intToSpecies

        Description: Retrieves the species associated with the selected option from the list of species.

        Preconditions:

        • intSpecies must be an integer within the range of species printed.

        Postconditions:

        • The species associated with the entered option is returned.
        Parameters:
        intSpecies - An integer representing the selected option from the list of species.
        Returns:
        The species that corresponds to the selected option from the list of species.
